intro: Schoenoplectiella aberrans, commonly known as the irregular sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in Europe. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family. Schoenoplectiella aberrans plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
